metadata.title: CVE-2023-7192 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - high
metadata.description:
A memory leak problem was found in ctnetlink_create_conntrack innet/netfilter/nf_conntrack_netlink.c in the Linux Kernel. This issue mayallow a local attacker with CAP_NET_ADMIN privileges to cause a denial ofservice (DoS) attack due to a refcount overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-7192` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.13.0-196.247
linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-196.247
linux-image-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.13.0-196.247
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-196.247
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-196.247
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-196.247
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-196.247
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-196.247
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.13.0-196.247
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.13.0-196.247
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-251.285~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-251.285~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-251.285~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-251.285~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-251.285~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-251.285~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-251.285~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-251.285~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-251.285~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1054-aws - 4.4.0-1128.134
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-196.247').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-251.285~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1128.134').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
